Class Melih

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • Melih
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(value="/Melih")
public class Melih
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This servlet is the main class for the individual implementation project Roman Emperors and their Years of Ascension.
    Since:
    2016-05-10
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Melih Barsbey
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • printTable

        public java.lang.String printTable(java.util.ArrayList<Melih_Data> allData)
        This method takes an array of data from the servlet [doGet] method which contains the entities the user wanted to save. This method creates and returns the html code required to print these entities out.
        Parameters:
        allData - The array includes the saved records from the doGet method.
        Returns:
        myTableOut This string includes the html code to be printed.

      • printOutputTable

        public java.lang.String printOutputTable(java.util.ArrayList<Melih_Data> myData,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Melih_Data> resultData,
                                         java.lang.String queriedYear)
        This method takes two arrays of data from inside the servlet [doGet] method, one which contains the entities in the database, and the other is the result user's query. The method returns the query table to be printed out.
        Parameters:
        myData - The array includes all the entities in the database table.
        resultData - The array includes the ten entites chosen to be as a result of the query.
        queriedYear - This is the string, containing the year the user entered .
        Returns:
        outputString This string includes the html code to be printed.

      • flushDatabase

        public void flushDatabase()
        This method takes no parameters and returns no values. The primary funciton of this method is to to delete the database, and recreate it and the necessary table within it. Then, the predetermined query is sent to Wikidata.org using the of [getHtml] method of [Melih_Wikidata] class, demanding the relevant data in JSON format. After the data is received, it is parsed into a MelihData object and sent to the Database to be inserted using the [addData] method of [Melih_DatabaseConnection] class.

      • getQueryResults

        public java.util.ArrayList<Melih_Data> getQueryResults(int intQuery)
        This method takes an integer parameter (year the user entered) and finds the emperors that ascended to the throne the closest to that year. It first obtains the data from the database using the [getData] method of [Melih_DatabaseConnection]. Then it finds the 10 emperors that ascended closest to that date. Then the method returns this list.
        Parameters:
        intQuery - The year that the user entered
        Returns:
        resultData The ten emperors with ascension dates closest to the entered year.
